intro: Cracca albicans, commonly known as the white cracca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cracca albicans is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
